documents.title: our top five yorkshire stories
text: that 's all from the team today , but we 'll be back on wednesday from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
before we go , let 's look back at a selection of our top stories from today :
north yorkshire police says it 's facing an `` unprecedented '' increase in calls to the force 's control room
a man is in hospital after a paintball shooting at a doncaster protest
leeds-based asda withdraws an own-brand type of newborn nappy after a family complains their baby suffered a `` chemical reaction '' to the product
an investigation 's under way in huddersfield after a gun was fired at a house at the weekend
three large textile artworks go on show along the bronte way in haworth in celebration of the famous literary sisters :
author: Oli Woodcock
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: 'explosion of creativity ' in selby
text: the first ever selby arts festival is well under way in the town .
it 's on for nine days and is described as an `` explosion of creativity and culture '' .
part of the festival involves transforming spaces and animating places , which is what appears to have happened here :
this creation was made in the festival takeover shop by members of the 154 collective .
the group 's made up of performers , painters writers , animators , dancers and musicians from west yorkshire .
if you know what it is - or think you know what it might be - please let us know !

documents.title: your evening weather forecast for yorkshire
text: a fine evening is expected for yorkshire with some sunny spells possible .
remaining dry overnight , with clear spells at first , light winds and perhaps the odd patch of mist .
however , cloud will thicken across western parts through the night .
the minimum temperature will be about 12c ( 54f ) :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: your memories : celebrating 50 years of leeds west indian carnival
text: the `` oldest carnival in europe '' is set to celebrate its 50th anniversary - and we want to hear your memories of five decades of this major festival .
the west indian carnival in leeds , which was launched in 1967 , will be held in potternewton park over the august bank holiday weekend .
an exhibition recording its heritage , political and cultural legacy is planned for the city 's tetley gallery .
the event , which attracts more than 100,000 people , will culminate in a parade through chapeltown and harehills .
as part of the 50th anniversary celebrations , we want to hear your questions and memories about leeds west indian carnival .
click here to get in touch with answers or to share your stories on the bbc website .

documents.title: tens of thousands of illegal cigarettes seized in huddersfield
text: illegal cigarettes worth over £ 50,000 have been seized by west yorkshire police and trading standards .
a total of 62,860 illegal cigarettes were seized in huddersfield at the weekend , along with 26kg of hand rolling tobacco , 219 illegal tobacco products and nearly £ 13,000 of cash .
the operation targeted a total of six premises in the town centre .
we 're incredibly pleased with the results achieved on saturday - it was a great success .
a lot of planning went into this operation with our partner agencies .
the items at market value came to several thousand pounds and we were able to make the streets of huddersfield safer . ''

documents.title: funeral held for under-14s stanley rangers rlfc player
text: the funeral of a boy from wakefield who died after suffering a head injury in an under-14s rugby league match has been held .
evan hawksworth was injured playing for stanley rangers rlfc against batley boys on 9 july and died in hospital later .
his funeral took place at holy trinity church in rothwell , west yorkshire .
evan 's family said at the time of his death it had been a `` tragic freak accident '' and no-one was to blame .
a crowdfunding page to support the family set up by stanley rangers rlfc and the rfl benevolent fund has raised more than £ 25,000 .

documents.title: york pedal power proves popular
text: trips by bike are increasing in york , new figures show .
the charity sustrans says an investment programme to encourage cycling for shorter urban journeys has seen a 6 % rise in the city - even though york already has high levels of riders .
the charity hopes the findings will help strengthen the case for investment in cycling and inspire and encourage programmes which get more people on their bikes in and around the city .

documents.title: missing bradford woman found 'safe and well '
text: earlier this afternoon we mentioned an appeal by police wanting help in finding a woman from bradford who 'd gone missing
officers were worried for the welfare of kelly bradley , 39 , who 'd abandoned a 999 call she 'd made to them in the early hours of monday morning .
happily , police say she 's now been found :
kelly bradley , who was the subject of a concern for welfare appeal earlier today has been found safe and well

documents.title: woman seriously hurt after being hit by car in sheffield
text: a 48-year-old woman has suffered serious injuries in a crash in sheffield .
the woman was hit by a car on manor oaks road at about 11:30 this morning .
a 32-year-old man has been arrested on sus of dangerous driving and driving while being disqualified .

documents.title: threats and car damage spark increased police patrols in huddersfield
text: police have increased patrols in part of huddersfield after a car was used to damage another vehicle and several men were seen making threats .
it happened last night in riddings road in sheepridge and occurred after a red seat ibiza was used to cause damage to a blue car .
the driver of a black vehicle which was travelling nearby then got out of their vehicle and threatened the occupants of the seat ibiza before making off towards chestnut street .
det insp mark atkinson says : `` we are working to trace parties involved in the incident and are progressing significant lines of enquiry . ''

documents.title: british record , now for the world champs
text: british record , now for the world champs

documents.title: larroyer banned for testicle grab
text: larroyer banned for testicle grab

documents.title: investigation launched after gun fired in huddersfield
text: an investigation 's under way in huddersfield after a gun was fired at a house at the weekend .
detectives are appealing for information after the weapon was fired in the ghyll , fixby , on sunday night .
they 're also keen to speak to anyone who might have cctv footage showing sus activity in the street between 23:00 and 00:00 on sunday .
no-one was injured but the door of a house was damaged , say police .
we fully understand the anxiety such an incident can cause in communities and local npt officers are providing extra patrols in the area today . ''

documents.title: delays issuing york city season tickets
text: if you 're desperate to get your hands on your york city season ticket , you 'll face a bit of a wait .
the club says the tickets wo n't now be available for collection until the end of next week due to a delay at the printers .
the club has apologised for the delay .

documents.title: watch : sheffield mum 's fundraising bid for daughter 's treatment
text: a mum from sheffield is campaigning to send her daughter to europe for life-changing surgery .
yasmin dennett has a severely curved spine and requires a specialist procedure which is not currently available in the uk .
if the fundraising attempt is unsuccessful , the 12-year-old could face spinal fusion , which can leave people permanently disabled :
author: Jenny Eells
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sign up to new bronte artwork in haworth
text: three large textile artworks have gone on show along the bronte way in haworth .
created by the artist lynn setterington , they 're celebrating the signatures of the famous bronte sisters .
members of the public are also being given the chance to sew their own signatures into the fabric .
the drop-in workshops in haworth will take place on tuesday 25 july and tuesday 15 august 2017 .

documents.title: north yorkshire force faces 'unprecedented ' rise in emergency calls
text: north yorkshire police says it 's putting several measures in place in an effort to deal with an `` unprecedented '' increase in calls to the force 's control room .
councillors said they 've been told of people spending up to six hours on the phone waiting to talk to someone from north yorkshire police .
responding , the force says it 's experienced a rise in the number of calls - particularly 999 calls - of about 20 % since may this year .
the force says that on sunday 18 june , for example , it received more calls than on new year 's eve , which is historically its busiest day of the year .
north yorkshire police 's deputy chief constable lisa winward says changes aimed at dealing with the rise in calls ca n't be `` done overnight '' .
`` we ask the public to please bear with us as we implement the improvement measures over the coming months , '' she says .
`` our control room staff are working extremely hard as we work to service the increase in demand and implement the changes . ''

documents.title: watch : pair finish first 2,500-mile open canoe circumnavigation of britain
text: a former west yorkshire police officer and his nephew have become the first canoe team ever to circumnavigate britain .
colin skeath , from huddersfield , says they carried out the trip to raise money for the forget me not hos
the pair spent nine weeks in their open canoe and travelled 2,500 miles ( 4,000km ) clockwise around britain .
here 's just a taster of what it was like for them :

documents.title: countdown continues to special olym in sheffield
text: britain 's got talent finalist kyle tomlinson is the latest name to be added the line up of the 2017 special olym opening ceremony in sheffield .
more than 20,000 people are expected to attend the event at bramall lane in two weeks time .
sheffield singer tomlinson will join the likes of tony hadley and james toseland performing to the crowds .
author: Jenny Eells
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: two injured after car hits york telegraph pole
text: two people are in a serious condition in hospital after their car hit a telegraph pole in the strensall area of york .
it happened at about 02:00 this morning at ox carr lane , after its junction with moor lane .
the two injured people , a 28-year-old woman and a 30-year-old man , are both from the york area .
police want people who have any information about the collision to contact them .
@ nyorksrpg want to hear from you if you witnessed a collision in strensall in the early hours of this morning :

documents.title: police fears for bradford woman after abandoned 999 call
text: police say they are worried about the whereabouts of kelly bradley , of bradford .
they say they 're concerned for her welfare after an abandoned 999 call was made to them in the early hours of monday .
the call was traced back to a mobile phone which is believed to belong to her .
kelly is 39-years-old and is described as being around 4ft 11ins tall and has brown eyes with long brown hair .
officers want anyone with information on her whereabouts to contact them .

documents.title: funeral held for under-14s rugby player
text: funeral held for under-14s rugby player

documents.title: crossrail 2 : support by government 'outrageous ' after northern snub
text: sheffield mp paul blomfield says there seems to be `` a mismatch '' between the resources put into transport in london and the south east and those that are needed in the north .
the labour politician was speaking after the transport secretary chris grayling backed london 's multi-billion pound crossrail 2 scheme .
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: decision time for sheffield-based radio station iman fm suspended over 'terror talks '
text: a sheffield radio station suspended over broadcasting hate speeches has until today to respond .
sheffield-based iman fm had its licence suspended by ofcom for playing lectures by radical american muslim cleric anwar al-awlaki (
awlaki was killed in a us drone strike in 2011 .
ofcom launched an investigation of the station after a member of the public complained about the content of the lectures .
the regulator said parts of the material was `` likely to encourage or incite crime or lead to disorder '' .
iman fm told ofcom it was not aware of awlaki 's background .
the regulator now has to decide either to lift the suspension or to revoke iman fm 's licence .

documents.title: lovers murder man for life insurance
text: lovers murder man for life insurance

documents.title: watch : deer rescue captured on film
text: it 's not often you get this close to a deer .
the young fawn was rescued by john walker from the canal at whitley lock near selby .
after an hour of warming up it recovered .
well done mr walker !

documents.title: york minster peregrine falcon chick rescue
text: a young peregrine falcon has been returned to its nest at the top of york minster after being spotted on the ground .
radio york presenters , adam & anna , were walking back from recording a feature for their programme when they spotted the bird on the ground .
they quickly phoned wildlife artist , robert e fuller , one of the people looking after the peregrines who , as it turned , out was already dashing to the rescue .
along with jean thorpe ( a raptor rescue rehabilitator , robert scaled the inside tower with the chick and pushed it back out on to a ledge near its nest .
york 's resident pair of peregrines are affectionately known as mr and mrs minster and are often seen perched on the cathedrals stone gargoyles or soaring high above the main tower .

documents.title: man in hospital after paintball shooting at doncaster protest
text: protestors in a doncaster village unhappy about about a fly problem near a recycling centre have been shot at by someone wearing a balaclava on a quad bike with a paintball gun .
a 71-year-old man is in hospital after being hit in the eye and arm .
about 30 protestors turned up at rossington to ask for action after problems they say are down to the recycling firm .
one person was hit in the eye and bbc radio sheffield reporter andy kershaw was hit in the chest .
a man 's been taken to hospital after being shot in the eye by a paintball gun during a protest against flies & noise in rossington doncaster
a protest against flies ?
yes , there 's a couple of companies flouting environmental rules and out villlage is now infested with flies .
also 100 's lorries a day : (
that 's awful cheryl - hope it gets sorted out - good on the protestors
thanks .
watch this space for more action , i have some plans of my own .
@ twitterid
was it a broomhandle mauser ?
be careful , that ma friend is a broomhandle mouser !
ant n dec at it again
thats horrendous i hope the person shot is ok
keep safe pal .
i understand you got hit too .

documents.title: listen : endurance glider to land in north yorkshire
text: a glider that 's on a 750 mile flight through the uk 's airspace will touch down in north yorkshire later .
the aircraft will land at burn gliding club , near selby , one of 13 stops it 's making as part of a campaign called glide britain .
russell walsh flies at burn and says the two-week journey , being captured on film , is aimed at getting more young people into gliding :
gliders can fly large distances , flights of more than 300 miles are common in the uk and the distance record exceeds 600 miles .
the british gliding association says gliders regularly achieve heights of 10,000 feet and the uk height record is 37,000 feet .

documents.title: kids names : ant & dec or baradi & jansson ?
text: yesterday i told you about an appeal for name suggestions for two baby pygmy goats born at easingwold 's maize maze .
the goats , a boy and a girl , were born last thursday .
their great-great-grandmother , a super nanny , was famous for being the second-oldest pygmy goat when she died aged 19 , earlier this year .
farmer and maze owner , paul caygill , said they 've not decided what to call the youngsters yet and he is open to suggestions , which you 've been happy to provide .
here 's a few we 've received so far :
i 've passed all of the above on to farmer paul .
more of your suggestions are welcome .
make yours by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : behind the beat - the howl , the hum , the drum !
text: here 's something you do n't see very often , the view from the drummer on stage .

jack , from york band the howl & the hum , kindly let us attach a camera to him , for the bands storming set in the obelisk tent at the deer shed festival near thirsk in north yorkshire : the howl , the hum , the drum !

documents.title: yorkshire 's weather today
text: there will be a good deal of cloud early on .
however it should gradually tend to become brighter with some sunny spells developing .
dry for most parts though an isolated shower is possible inland through the afternoon .
it should remain fine through the evening and overnight with clear periods .

documents.title: three arrested after cannabis find in north yorkshire town
text: a 33-year-old woman and two 48-year-old men have been arrested , and a small quantity of cannabis plants seized after a tip-off from member of the public in malton .
police say they found a number of cannabis plants at the property along with a small quantity of a class a substance .
a spokesperson for north yorkshire police said : people should be alert to the signs of cannabis cultivation in their area , and report any sus they have to the police - we will take action . ''

documents.title: pair complete first uk open canoe epic
text: pair complete first uk open canoe epic

documents.title: asda little angels nappy withdrawn after baby 'left blistered '
text: asda has withdrawn an own-brand type of newborn nappy after a family complained their baby had suffered a `` chemical reaction '' to the product .
jordan bartliff , from south yorkshire , put images showing his premature son 's red and blistered skin on facebook .
the father is warning other parents he fears there is a `` bad batch '' of the little angels newborn nappies .
asda said `` our hearts go out to the bartliff family '' , adding it had withdrawn the product for tests .

documents.title: man shot in eye with paintball gun during village protest about flies
text: a man has been taken to hospital after being shot in the eye with a paintball gun during a protest against flies and noise in rossington , doncaster .
the police and an ambulance have been called to the doncaster village this morning - after protestors unhappy about flies in their area were fired upon by a man on a quad bike with a paintball gun .
people are unhappy with the use of lorries through the area and say the flies are coming from a nearby recycling centre .
police say they wo n't tolerate violence after residents in rossington protesting against a plague of flies and lorry noise were shot at .
really strange that a quad thug would be up at 7 in the morning .
hmmmm
not really the scrap firm is busy from 0600
surely there must be a reason for this ?
what has been dumped to provide such a breeding ground for the flies ?
it 's believed to be domestic food waste tins
they just need to put down fly traps and kill them to get rid of them .
to stop them from getting in their houses they can keep windows shut
so what are doncaster council going to do about it @ twitterid
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: lottery cash for rotherham homeless charity
text: the shiloh centre in rotherham is to get £ 254,000 from the big lottery fund to support its work with homeless and vulnerable people .
the charity has been supporting people in rotherham who are going through a difficult time in their life for 25 years .

documents.title: investigation into six-hour wait for north yorkshire 101 response
text: there 's a call for an urgent review into the 101 non-emergency police number in north yorkshire .
councillors say they 've been told of people spending up to six hours on the phone waiting to talk to someone .
they say they 've heard people phoning the non-emergency number had either to abandon their call or think about dialling 999 instead .

north yorkshire 's police and crime commissioner , julia mulligan , says there 's been a 20 % rise in calls to the non-emergency number over the last three months and is investigating why this is happening .

documents.title: listen : surprise leeds visit by england football manager
text: england football manager gareth southgate is in leeds today to surprise a group of children at a training session .
it 's part of a programme to encourage young people to keep playing sports over the summer holidays .
samuel wakefield represents lidl , which is running the programme , and says it should be quite a shock :

documents.title: funeral of teenage rugby player evan hawksworth to take place
text: the funeral of a west yorkshire schoolboy , who died while playing rugby league , will take place this lunchtime in rothwell .
evan hawksworth , 14 , suffered a head injury while playing for stanley rangers against batley boys , earlier this month .
he never regained consciousness .
in a statement issued by the stanley rangers club , evan 's dad , gary , has thanked his family and friends for their continued overwhelming support .
he also acknowledged the respect and affection given to evan by the wider rugby league family .
those attending today 's funeral have been asked to wear brightly coloured clothes and evan 's team mates to wear club or school colours .
any money donated will go to martin house children 's hos the children 's intensive care unit at the lgi and to stanley rangers , to build a new pitch in evan 's name .

documents.title: lisa gallagher has the weather forecast
text: here 's lisa gallagher with our weather forecast :

documents.title: listen : 'prisoners ' of flies in rossington
text: there 's a further protest today at rossington in doncaster because of a continuing issue with flies in the village .
people are unhappy with the use of lorries through the area and say the flies are coming from a nearby recycling centre .
cheryl moy lives nearby and describes what it 's like :
the environment agency has been working with nearby recycling firm , morris metals .
the company says it does n't believe it is the only cause of the problem , but adds it has stopped stockpiling organic material .

documents.title: check your train journey this morning
text: if you 're heading out to catch a train this morning you 'll be glad to know the services across our region all seem to be running largely to time at the moment .
you can click on the links below to keep up to date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage across yorkshire
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on tuesday 25 july 2017 .
we 'll be with you throughout the day with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
i thought we 'd start today with this beautiful and dramatic bbc weather watcher pic of embsay - it seems to sum up the current yorkshire climate , dry one minute , sodden the next !
if you have something to share with us and the rest of yorkshire , you can do so by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
